metadata.name: Learnings - Type Safety
metadata.description: Learnings and fixes for Type Safety

learning.title: CircuitBreaker Type Duplication Consolidation
learning.description: Successfully consolidated 5 duplicate CircuitBreaker class definitions into a single source of truth at app/core/circuit_breaker.py, achieving compliance with type_safety.xml single source of truth principle.

problem.summary: CircuitBreaker class was defined in 5 different files, violating single source of truth

impact.item: Type safety violations due to multiple definitions
Inconsistent interfaces and behavior across modules
Maintenance burden with changes needed in multiple files
Import confusion and potential runtime errors

solution.approach: Consolidate to single canonical implementation with backwards-compatible redirects

steps.step: Identified app/core/circuit_breaker.py as most comprehensive implementation
Updated imports in fallback_manager.py to use canonical source
Replaced duplicate classes with re-export modules for backwards compatibility
Created compatibility wrapper in error_recovery.py for legacy interface
Ran smoke tests to verify no regressions

key-learnings.learning: Always identify the most comprehensive implementation as the canonical source
Create re-export modules for backwards compatibility during consolidation
Use import redirects to break circular dependencies
Validate all imports work after consolidation to prevent import errors

learning.title: ResearchType Circular Import and Duplication Fix
learning.description: Successfully resolved circular import error by consolidating duplicate ResearchType definitions and updating all imports to use the canonical source, following the single source of truth principle.

problem.summary: Circular import error due to duplicate ResearchType enum definitions
problem.error_message: ImportError: cannot import name 'ResearchType' from partially initialized module 'app.agents.supply_researcher_sub_agent'

circular_chain.step: supply_research/scheduler_models.py tried to import ResearchType from supply_researcher_sub_agent

impact.item: Test modules failing to import due to circular dependency
Type safety violations due to duplicate enum definitions
Inconsistent enum values across different modules
Multiple import paths for the same type

solution.approach: Consolidate to canonical source and update all imports

steps.step: Identified app/agents/supply_researcher/models.py as canonical source (most comprehensive)
Added legacy scheduler values to canonical ResearchType for backwards compatibility
Updated scheduler_models.py to import from canonical source
Updated all test files to import from canonical source
Verified no circular import errors remain

files-changed.file: app/agents/supply_researcher/models.py - Added legacy enum values for compatibility

validation.test: Verified all 13 enum values available including legacy scheduler values

key-learnings.learning: Always check for duplicate type definitions before creating new ones
Import directly from canonical source to avoid circular dependencies
Add legacy values to canonical source for backwards compatibility
Update all import paths systematically when consolidating types
Test import chains after fixing to ensure no circular dependencies remain
